Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2017 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This National Science Foundation award funds Student Travel Fellowships for US students attending ICDE 2017, the 2017 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering, the main goal of which is the sharing of scientific information and knowledge among participants. The Student Fellowships helps cover the travel costs for US students, making it possible for them to attend the conference and interact with other members of the community.

The ICDE conference has a multi-faceted program that includes keynote addresses, technical paper presentations, application track sessions, industry track sessions, demonstrations, PhD symposium, tutorials, panels and poster sessions. All these activities are opportunities for students to share their research work and knowledge with researchers from both academia and industry.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of this award was to provide travel fellowships to a limited number of US students in order for them to attend the 2017 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE).

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) addresses research issues in designing, building, managing, and evaluating advanced data-intensive systems and applications. It is a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences. In 2017, the conference was held in San Diego, California.

The selection of students to receive the travel fellowship was performed by a committee of five university professors from DePaul University, Duke University, Harvard University, and the University of Pittsburgh. Priority was given to supporting students who are either members of groups that are under-represented at the conference (e.g., undergraduate students, women, or members of other minorities) OR they would be attending the ICDE for the first time.

A total of 113 applications were received, out of which 25 students were selected to receive the travel fellowship.

All students were asked to provide testimonials so that we can evaluate the impact of the travel fellowship in their professional development. As evidence of the significant impact this travel fellowship had, we reproduce three such testimonials next.

"I would like to start my words by thanking the ones who provided such a great opportunity for me to attend ICDE 2017. It was a great experience for me to meet top researchers around the world, present/discuss my research, and get exposed to the latest research results in the field. I believe ICDE 2017 was a huge success and I really enjoyed it as a junior researcher. By providing such an award, you made this possible. Thanks!"

"I enjoyed my time at the conference. I was able to hear interesting talks and network with like-minded people in my field. Thank you for helping me attend."

"ICDE 2017 was fantastic in all aspects. I found many presentations and was motivated by several new friends. The committee did a great job in organizing the conference (food, location, side events)."
